medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset right upper quadrant and epigastric pain radiating to the middle of lower back.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began suddenly 7 hours prior to presentation, following a late lunch, and has persisted without improvement. The patient has never experienced pain as severe as this but reports occasional postprandial discomfort relieved with Pepto-Bismol. Since the onset of pain, she has experienced nausea and vomiting (3 episodes of watery non-bilious emesis).
medical_history.past_medical_history: hypercalcemia, depression with history of 2 hospitalizations and ECT, fibromyalgia, pulmonary nodule, obstructive sleep apnea (OSA), history of H. pylori, history of uterine fibroids.
medical_history.family_history: Mother: renal cell carcinoma, depression, myocardial infarction; Father: hypertension, stroke; Brother: leukemia.
